data.title: Race against time for rescuers as hundreds feared dead in Mayotte
data.description: SAINT-DENIS DE LA REUNION - Rescuers raced against time Monday to reach survivors after a devastating cyclone ripped through the French Indian Ocean territory of Mayotte, destroying homes across the islands, with hundreds feared dead.

data.title: EU sending envoy to talk to Syria's new leaders
data.description: DAMASCUS - The EU

data.title: Israel aims to 'double population' in annexed Golan: PM
data.description: JERUSALEM - The Israeli government approved on Sunday a plan to increase the population of the annexed Golan Heights, while insisting it had no intention of confronting Syria after seizing a UN-monitored buffer zone.

data.title: Black day? Guinness runs dry in UK pubs amid online craze
data.description: LONDON - At her London pub, landlady Kate Davidson has taken to issuing Guinness ration cards, but still the beer has run out amid a UK shortage of Ireland

data.title: End of the Dubai dream for Europe's drug lords?
data.description: PARIS - Drug lords like Sean McGovern, a top lieutenant of the Kinahan cartel, and Faissal Taghi -- son of the infamous head of the Dutch-Moroccan Mocro Maffia -- used to hang out and party in Dubai

data.title: 'Bali Nine' drug ring prisoners 'relieved' on return home
data.description: SYDNEY - The five remaining members of the Australian "Bali Nine" drug ring say they are "relieved and happy" over their return home after 19 years in jail in Indonesia.

data.title: South Korea's Yoon resists questioning over failed martial law bid
data.description: SEOUL - Impeached South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol resisted investigators

data.title: Five years on from the pandemic, long Covid keeps lives on hold
data.description: VIENNA - Three years ago, Andrea Vanek was studying to be an arts and crafts teacher when spells of dizziness and heart palpitations suddenly started to make it impossible for her to even take short walks.

data.title: Philippine Senate ratifies military access agreement with Japan
data.description: MANILA - The Philippine Senate on Monday ratified a reciprocal access agreement (RAA) with Japan that would allow their militaries to deploy on each other

data.title: Indonesia to repatriate Filipino drugs convict this week
data.description: JAKARTA - Indonesia will transfer Mary Jane Veloso, a Filipino woman who was sentenced to death for drug trafficking, to her home country in the early hours of Wednesday morning, a senior Indonesian official said.

data.title: Myanmar’s war has forced doctors and nurses into prostitution
data.description: After seven years of medical school in Myanmar, May finally achieved her goal of becoming a doctor. But a month after she graduated and found a job, her dreams started unravelling.

data.title: Oldest human genomes reveal how a small group burst out of Africa
data.description: NEW YORK - About 45,000 years ago, a tiny group of people - fewer than 1,000 - wandered the icy northern fringes of Europe. Across thousands of miles of tundra, they hunted woolly rhinoceros and other big game. Their skin was most likely dark.

data.title: Hong Kong police arrest 2 men over thefts on planes arriving from Vietnam
data.description: Hong Kong police have arrested two men in a week for allegedly stealing cash from passengers

data.title: Turkey ready to offer military training to Syria if new govt requests
data.description: ANKARA - The new administration in  Syria  should be given a chance to govern following their constructive messages, and  Turkey  stands ready to provide military training if such help is requested, Turkish Defence Minister Yasar Guler said.

data.title: Australia says 'Bali Nine' prisoners have returned home
data.description: The five remaining members of the Australian "Bali Nine" drug ring have returned home after 19 years in jail in Indonesia, the Australian government said Sunday.

data.title: Vietnam’s ex-president given disciplinary ‘warning’
data.description: Vietnam’s Politburo has issued a disciplinary “warning” to former president Nguyen Xuan Phuc for violating anti-corruption regulations, the latest step in a sweeping anti-graft campaign that has ensnared hundreds of officials and business executives.

data.title: Brazil arrests ex-defence minister over coup plot
data.description: RIO DE JANEIRO - Federal police arrested Brazil’s former defence minister Walter Souza Braga Netto on Saturday, two sources told Reuters, after he was accused in November of plotting a coup to overturn the results of the 2022 election.

data.title: US starts relocating Marines from Okinawa
data.description: TOKYO - The United States has begun relocating thousands of Marines from the Japanese island of Okinawa, officials in Tokyo and Washington said on Saturday, after decades of mounting grievances among locals over America’s military presence.

data.title: Ex-Man City striker set to be Georgia's new far-right president
data.description: TBILISI — Georgian ex-footballer turned far-right politician Mikheil Kavelashvili is set to become Tbilisi

data.title: South Korean president impeached
data.description: SEOUL - South Korea’s opposition-led parliament impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol on Saturday, voting to suspend him from his official duties over his short-lived attempt last week to impose martial law.

data.title: Trump calls for end to daylight saving time
data.description: WASHINGTON - US President-elect Donald Trump says the Republican Party “will use its best efforts” to end daylight saving time, which he called “inconvenient, and very costly to our Nation”.

data.title: Prince Andrew embroiled in Chinese ‘spy’ flap
data.description: LONDON - A Chinese businessman who had forged close links with Prince Andrew and was authorised to act on his behalf to seek investors in China has been banned from Britain on national security grounds.

data.title: Six rare giant catfish surface in Cambodia
data.description: PHNOM PENH — Conservationists in Cambodia on Friday celebrated the discovery of six highly endangered Mekong giant catfish in the critical Southeast Asian waterway plagued by illegal fishing, habitat loss and plastic waste.
